item.title: My First Post
item.description: MathJax.Hub.Config({tex2jax: { inlineMath: [['$','$'], ['\\(','\\)']], displayMath: [['$$','$$']], skipTags: ["script","noscript","style","textarea","pre"], processEnvironments: true }}); I finally got GitHub working as a host for the site! Starting this Friday, I’m going to start posting weekly research updates, to both track my progress and work on my techinical writing skills. <<<<<<< HEAD I even got $z = x + y$ working. I even got $$equations$$ working. >>>>>>> 4fdc426636b452f9adb9af4c440c08057601be8c

item.title: About Josh
item.description: Pronouns: He/Him/His I am third year graduate research assistant working with Roman Grigoriev in the Center for Non-Linear Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology. My journey in physics has taken me to many different institutions and through many different fields, but each stepping stone has slowly led me towards pursuing non-linear dynamics and pattern formation on fields. One day, one of us is going to make sense of the chaos that is non-linear dynamics in infinite dimensional systems.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Talks Extreme Events on a Bi-Lobed Inertial Manifold in 2D Kolmogorov Flow, DFD Seattle 2019. Publications Renormalization of Discrete-Time Quantum Walks with non-Grover Coins, 2017
